comment: Thought I would enjoy the class but she has very strong opinions of what is right and wrong and she expresses her views openly.  If you have views other than hers, keep them to yourself.

Liked her at first but as the semester went on I dreaded going to class. She is VERY opinionated and if you don't agree with her, you're wrong. She is way too nit picky on grammar and very unclear on due dates. Make sure you know the class calendar from her syllabus backwards and forwards. Packs a lot of homework in at the end of the semester.

Took an honors section for her. She seemed to like everyone at first, but quickly chose favorites. WAY too much classwork crammed towards the end of the semester (3 huge projects due in 2 weeks...unrealistic!). Have to work EXTREMELY hard for an "A". Unclear about requirements for various projects (MAJOR points deducted for unclear requirements).

Very nice professor.  Will lend help if you need it.  Took Honors section, and had to read 1 novel, and write a few papers (including a lengthy research project) which actually was pretty enjoyable.  Just pick something that interests you.  Overall nice, but will definitely let you know grammer errors with grading.  At times a 100 seems impossible.

This professor will make you work for an A.  I was in an Honors section and she takes the whole Honors thing very seriously.  Do exactly as she instructs for every assignment and you will definitely get an A or a B.  She is not an easy professor, but I am a better writer because I took her class.

One of my favorite professors. She has a good sense of humor and enjoys what she does. Very little reading except for research project. She encourages students to work very hard and makes an A attainable. TIPS: engage in discussion and avoid stupid grammar mistakes (those drive her crazyy! TAKE HER IF YOU CAN! :)

She tries very hard to get you interested and involved. Four main papers (3-5 pages each), one group powerpoint presentation, two tests. The only challenge in this class is managing your time well and getting the papers written.

She's okay. Neither good nor bad. But she's very opinionated, so whatever you do don't disagree with her. She's also a tough grader. You'll do a presentation in front of the class and she'll take points off if you look nervous. She's always available to talk to, so take advantage of that. She'll help you but only if you ask her.

AMAZING. There is a lot of work, and you really have to try. When writing papers ASK FOR HELP, she'll never not help (not sure she's capable of it). She is kinda picky, but if you ask she'll tell you what you need to fix and you can avoid losing points.
This professor is amazing. I took her RGTE class and I am so glad I had to take her class. She is AWESOME. She will teach you how to write 101.

Professor Brantley is one of the best (if not the best) professors at KSU. She is sweet and extreme helpful when it comes to students writing papers and will let you schedule office hours so she can proofread your paper and give you advice before the due. I'd recommend this professor to anyone who has to take English 1101!!!
she was great! an awesome teacher! super helpful! meet with her and she will tell you anything you need to know, come to class, and you will be fine!
this class was soo hard and ALOT of work. i ended up with an A but i worked my butt off all semster. just make appointments with her to help on your papers and you should be alright.

Prof Brantley is a great professor to have for a first year english class. She is extremely helpful when it comes to papers, and you only have 4 for the semester. She is not a hard grader on her papers, but make sure you turn them in ON TIME!! She is very strict about that. If you dont turn one paper in, you will fail the class.

YOU WANT HER!! She is awesome. She is very helpful. Set up meeting with her and she will correct your papers for her class before you turn them in! She is professional and it's very possible to make and A in this class. I love Mrs. Brantley!

Good teacher. It is worth making appointments to see her before you turn in an essay, she will grade it for you and tell you what you need to make an A. Only 2 quizes, the second one was a little hard. Only 4 essays.  Overall easy class.
GREAT TEACHER. u only write 4 papers. she doesnt give tests. only like 4 quizes and they are really easy. she is EXTREMELY passionate about english. Great teacher i wish she taught ENGL 1102.
Awesome teacher! I hate English classes but she made this one of my favorites! She's fun, pretty laid back, and very helpful!
LOVE HER! She is so entertaining and as long as you apply yourself, you'll get an A.  Write a lot of essay, but develop your skills. Not painful at all. TAKE HER CLASS.
She is a pretty good teacher. The class is easy and you only have to write 3 papers. I dont like english and the class didnt seem boring to me at all. Take Ms. Brantley. She is easy.
Mrs. Brantley is pretty cool! I loved Mrs. Brantley and I think that you should definitely consider taking her class! I hate English but she makes it easy!

Clarity is there. Yet the work load is tough. 8-10 page reasearch paper, but you get 2-3 peer reviews. She doesn't take any excuses...Which can be good and bad... Overall she's just an alright teacher

Brantley is a very organized professor. My grade consisted of 4 essays, a few quizzes, and a newspaper project that was thrown together in two nights. She allows her students to see her during office hours and is more than willing to help out with essays. She was 5 minutes late maybe three or four times. I enjoyed her class :)

very precise and detailed- newspaper project was a miserable burden on the whole class- shes always late to class and gives LOTS of assignments. when ur done with one she gives you another right away- very organized, but not that great of a class
